Hey Squad,

I'm having some issues designing a generator for the Universal Storage mod. This issue is the small numbers involved.

My generator turns water into Hydrogen and Oxygen using electrolysis. To work it takes a small amount of water to create a larger amount of both gasses.

The long and short of it is that the game won't currently work with a rate below 0.0005 units per second or resource, which stops the generator working, except when running at high, on-rails, acceleration.

I'm guessing it's because the game is rounding the low value to 0, but it might be another issue.

My request is to remove this limitation so that the game can cope with these small resource fractions.

<G-Mobile> Technicalfool: decrease the unit size so transactions involve larger quantities but functionally achieve the same result

<The_Duck> sure

<honestly> <- luketheduke

<zengei> Technicalfool, I assume this is what you're running into? http://bugs.kerbalspaceprogram.com/issues/2568

<Eye_of_Jeb> ^ : Bug #2568: Requestresource returns 0 for request values below 0.0001 - Kerbal Space Program - Squad Bugtracker

<Technicalfool> G-Mobile, heh, so basiclaly rescale things then? I guess it sounds like a plan.

<Technicalfool> oh it's not me, it's the guy who posted that thread.

<G-Mobile> Technicalfool: for instance, if they're saying 1 unit is 1 litre, switch to 1 unit is 1 ml

<Technicalfool> yeah, rescale things.

<Xaiier> that is odd still though

<Technicalfool> does seem odd to not at least go down to whatever the float minimum is.

<G-Mobile> also I think this is a specific fault with ModuleGenerator, so custom code should circumvent it

<zengei> http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/system.single.epsilon%28v=vs.110%29.aspx

<Eye_of_Jeb> ^ : Single.Epsilon Field (System)

I.... hope that helps, anyway. Basically a little chat with the modders to see how they fudge around the issue.
